claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling.

evidence.quote: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling.
Type I interferon response score (normalized units) | 3.1 | 1.0

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: mRNA vaccination increases the breadth of the peptide repertoire appearing on MHC-I.

evidence.quote: Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome | 40.6% | 20.6%
A broader peptide repertoire appears on MHC-I, improving tumor visibility to T cells.

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccine sensitizes tumors to anti-PD-L1 therapy.

evidence.quote: The study supports a biologically coherent hypothesis that intratumoral mRNA vaccination can prime tumors for stronger ICI responses
Combined intervention improves tumor control in mice and aligns with better outcomes in the retrospective human cohort.

claims.caveat: The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely.

claims.claim: SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination status is associated with improved survival in human patients receiving ICI.

evidence.quote: Retrospective human survival comparison p-value | p=0.01 | N/A | Vaccinated subgroup had improved survival under ICI treatment
aligns with better outcomes in the retrospective human cohort.

claims.caveat: Tumor-type mix and treatment-history heterogeneity limit direct causal interpretation.
